column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////But I was not alone. I brought with me a friend from Russia who was also attending the conference
column2: and I had the unlucky task of trying to explain this odd beast that vaguely resembles the Platonic ideal of pizza. "The sauce is on top." "But why?" "Who can explain the mysteries of this earth?" Fortunately
column3: Malnati's provided an excellent example of the red-topped step-child of the pizza family
column5: topped with sausage, tasted fantastic and certainly stands as one of the best Chicago-styles I've had. Which is probably a good thing, because, you know, it's like authentic or something.
